alert.note: Alert for Berks; Bucks; Chester; Lehigh; Montgomery; Northampton (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 01 at 6:27PM EDT until April 01 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 700 PM EDT FOR HUNTERDON...SOUTHWESTERN MORRIS...SOUTHERN WARREN...SOUTHEASTERN BERKS...SOUTHEASTERN LEHIGH...MONTGOMERY...NORTHWESTERN BUCKS... NORTHEASTERN CHESTER AND SOUTH CENTRAL NORTHAMPTON COUNTIES... At 627 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Long Valley to Frenchtown to near Phoenixville, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. Locations impacted include... Norristown, Pottstown, Phoenixville, Lansdale, West Norriton, East Norriton, Quakertown, Perkasie, Doylestown, Byram, Souderton, Bedminster, Washington, Birdsboro, Collegeville, Royersford, Flemington, Chalfont, Tinicum and High Bridge. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 296 and 303, and between mile markers 326 and 328. Northeast Extension between mile markers 23 and 46. Interstate 76 in Pennsylvania near mile marker 327. Interstate 78 in New Jersey between mile markers 1 and 26. Interstate 176 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 1 and 3. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for northern and northwestern New Jersey...and southeastern Pennsylvania. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
